Description: A series of fragments from the funerary papyrus of a man named Nebmaat (?), with monochrome black pigment opening vignette in which a man offers to a throned deity, and parts of at least two, probably three columns of horizontal lines of hieratic text with Book of the Dead chapter 1.
Excavator/field collector: Field Collection by: William John Bankes
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (134787) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/134787)
Taylor et al 2011 / The history and conservation of the papyrus of Tuy (p.98)
Condition: Papyrus Survey: Condition Details: Papyrus: loss Black ink Mount Details: Sandwich: glass Binding: magic tape Binding: self adhesive tape Object Priority: A Mount Priority: A Overall Condition: A Curatorial condition comment: torn but solid
